 Check to see if oid represents a database table object. More...
 

Detailed Description

Bookmarks are used to remember a cursor's position.

A cursor can only use bookmarks if it has the DB_CAN_BOOKMARK flag set. SQL cursors cannot be bookmarked.

Function Documentation

◆ db_oid_init()

db_result_t db_oid_init ( db_oid_t *  oid,
db_heap_t  heap 
)

Initialize database object id.

Parameters
oidDatabase object id.
heapPointer to heap.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Database object id is null.
See also
db_oid_destroy, db_oid_equal, db_oid_copy, db_oid_reset,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

Parameters
oidDatabase object id.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Object ID is null.
See also

◆ db_oid_copy()

db_result_t db_oid_copy ( db_oid_t *  dst,
const db_oid_t *  src 
)

Object id assignment operator.

Parameters
dstDestination database object id.
srcSource database object id.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL One of the two or both object IDs is/are null.
See also
db_oid_init, db_oid_destroy, db_oid_equal, db_oid_reset,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_oid_equal()

int db_oid_equal ( const db_oid_t *  oid_a,
const db_oid_t *  oid_b 
)

Object id comparison operator.

Parameters
oid_aDatabase object id.
oid_bDatabase object id.
Returns
  • True if database objects are equal
  • False othersize

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL One of the two or both object IDs is/are null.

db_oid_init, db_oid_destroy, db_oid_copy, db_oid_reset,

◆ db_oid_extract_tableid()

db_result_t db_oid_extract_tableid ( db_oid_t *  tid,
const db_oid_t *  oid 
)

Extract the table id from an object id.

Parameters
tidDestination for table id.
oidSource object id.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.
Precondition
oid represents a table or row.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Caused by: Destination for table ID is null, source object ID is null.
See also
db_oid_t,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_is_noid()

int db_is_noid ( const db_oid_t *  oid)

Check if oid DOES NOT represent an object in the database.

Returns
True when oid does not represent an object in the database.
Parameters
oidDatabase object id.
Returns
  • True if oid DOES NOT represent an object in the database.
  • False if oid DOES represent an object in the databaase.
  • -1 indicating an invalid oid parameter.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Database object ID is null.
See also
db_oid_t,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_is_rowid()

int db_is_rowid ( const db_oid_t *  oid)

Check to see if oid represents a database row object.

Parameters
oidDatabase object id.
Returns
  • True if oid represents a database row id.
  • False if oid does not represent a database row id.
  • -1 indicating an invalid oid parameter.
Note
This function does not check the current state of the object in the database. It may have been removed since the object id was created.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Database object ID is null.
See also
db_oid_t,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_is_tableid()

int db_is_tableid ( const db_oid_t *  oid)

Check to see if oid represents a database table object.

Parameters
oidDatabase object id.
Returns
  • True if oid represents a database table id.
  • False if oid does not represent a database table id.
  • -1 indicating an invalid oid parameter.
Note
This function does not check the current state of the object in the database. It may have been removed since the object id was created.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Database object ID is null.
See also
db_oid_t,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling
